abstract: Congress appears to be on brink of ending crude oil export ban as part of spending and tax deal that will close out legislative year; support for provision to end ban was created by alliance of lawmakers led by Sens Lisa Murkowski, Republican of Alaska, and Heidi Heitkamp, Democrat of North Dakota.
lead_paragraph: After months of cajoling by senators from two oil-producing states, Congress seems to be on the verge of lifting the ban as part of a giant year-end spending and tax deal.

headline.main: End of Crude Oil Export Ban Is Possible
headline.print_headline: End of Crude Oil Export Ban Is Possible

snippet: After months of cajoling by senators from two oil-producing states, Congress seems to be on the verge of lifting the ban as part of a giant year-end spending and tax deal.
